description: [Status: stable] [Name: unnecessary-range-start] [Message: Unnecessary start argument in range] What it does Checks for range calls with an unnecessary start argument. Why is this bad? range(0, x) is equivalent to range(x), as 0 is the default value for the start argument. Omitting the start argument makes the code more concise and idiomatic. Example range(0, 3) Use instead: range(3)
